<Link id="l00081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="81"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="82"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The only instances of MetadataInfo are the constants above, so a set of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="83"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// them may simply store pointers to them. To deterministically generate code,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="84"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// we need to use a set with stable iteration order, such as SetVector.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="85" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-sanitizerbinarymetadata-cpp-/#ac187378a0f56ec05fb9cc1661ae34207"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">using </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/anonymous-sanitizerbinarymetadata-cpp-/#ac187378a0f56ec05fb9cc1661ae34207">MetadataInfoSet</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/setvector">SetVector&lt;const MetadataInfo &#42;&gt;</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Determines which set of metadata to collect for this instruction.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Returns true if covered metadata is required to unambiguously interpret</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// other metadata. For example, if we are interested in atomics metadata, any</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// function with memory operations (atomic or not) requires covered metadata</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to determine if a memory operation is atomic or not in modules compiled</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with SanitizerBinaryMetadata.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> runOn(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>, MetadataInfoSet &amp;MIS, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdbuilder">MDBuilder</a> &amp;MDB,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlight">             uint64&#95;t &amp;FeatureMask);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We declare the &#95;add and &#95;del functions as weak, and only call them if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// there is a valid symbol linked. This allows building binaries with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// semantic metadata, but without having callbacks. When a tool that wants</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>.hasFnAttribute(Attribute::Naked))</span></CodeLine>
